awd_titl_txt: Conference: The Seventh Annual Meeting of SIAM Central States Section
awd_abstract_narration:
The 7th Annual Meeting of Society of Industrial and Applied Mathematicians Central States Section (SIAM-CCS) will be held at the Stillwater campus of Oklahoma State University during October 1-2, 2022. The conference website is https://siamcss2022.okstate.edu/. The SIAM Central States Section (SIAM-CSS) was founded in 2014, and it serves SIAM members in eight central states in the United States, including Arkansas, Colorado, Iowa, Kansas, Mississippi, Missouri, Nebraska, and Oklahoma. The SIAM-CSS Annual Meeting has been held annually since 2015, with the primary goal of improving the development of applied and computational mathematics throughout all central states, as well as facilitating knowledge transfer and promoting interdisciplinary collaborations among applied mathematics and other disciplines in science and engineering. 

The SIAM-CSS annual conference series provides an important forum for applied and computational mathematicians from central states to present their latest achievements, communicate and exchange ideas, and enhance collaborations. It provides an excellent opportunity for researchers in all stages of their careers, especially early career mathematicians, to establish interactions with researchers from all over the U.S. and other countries. It is essential in stimulating research activities in relatively less developed states. As the first face-to-face meeting after the pandemic, the conference will bring vitality to the applied math community in the region and promote the development of the discipline. This NSF grant will solely support the participation of students, postdoctoral scholars, early career faculty, and underrepresented groups in STEM.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
The SIAM Central States Section was founded in 2014 to serve SIAM members in Arkansas, Colorado, Iowa, Kansas, Mississippi, Missouri, Nebraska, and Oklahoma. The 7th Annual Meeting of SIAM Central States Section was hosted during October 1-2, 2022, on the Stillwater campus of Oklahoma State University. The conference featured 3 plenary lectures, 148 mini-symposium talks in 15 themes, and 17 contributed talks. For further details, please visit the conference website:  https://siamcss2022.okstate.edu/. 

Focused on applied and computational mathematics, the conference served as a great platform for both junior and senior researchers across the nation, mainly from central states. It facilitated the exchange of ideas and cultivation of collaborations among various fields, including applied mathematics, numerical analysis, scientific computing, and related applications.

This grant has been used to support 40 graduate students, postdoctoral fellows, early-career faculty members, and researchers from underrepresented minority groups to attend this conference. The conference served as an excellent opportunity for regional researchers at all career stages, particularly benefiting young faculty members, postdocs, and graduate students, enabling them to present their research findings, engage in interdisciplinary discussions, and enhance their communication and presentation skills. Moreover, the conference aimed to invite, encourage, and support participation from minority and underrepresented groups. 


Last Modified: 12/06/2023
Modified by: Xu Zhang
